experience: You and Bruno both know Trish Bear, Max Hansen, and 152 others

Design and implemetation of SMB to Enterprise level Networks and Support Infrastructure. Making it easy for the client. All the responsibilities of previous positions but spread accross multiple clients, businesses and endeavors...
When you need it done the right way, right away!Anything and everything to do with Networks, Computers, hardware and software. Specializing in MIDI and Digital Audio.
Active Directory and Exchange Management. Remote User Support - SalesForce, Postini and LogMeIn Administrator. Domain Migration Admin.

After nearly 9 months as a Contract Employee, I was offered a full time position with Syntellect. My duties and responsibilities continued to expand for the next 4 years as I constantly educated myself and took on new projects. I was responsible for maintaining our Network Infrastructure as well as offering input as to design and growth. I focused on exceptional User Support as well as Back-Up and Disaster Recovery for the Enterprise. I eventually ended up becoming Back-Up and DR Administrator, maintaining all of our backups and successfully recovering the Network from data losses and server failures. During the course of both of these tangents, I also developed my skill at interacting with both vendors and support providers so as to optimize the benefits that Syntellect received from both. I was Administrator for our Sales Force, CommVault Shoretel, Postini, LogMeIn, Sophos services as well as MS Active Directory and System Center and our Support Ticketing System. I have complete mastery of anything Microsoft, PC and MAC, and am able to navigate and configure Cisco and HP Network Appliances as well as Shoretel VOIP equipment and software. I was also responsible for guiding new IT hires as well as helping them acclimate easily.

Basically repsonsible for anything and everything related to network infrastructure, user "happiness", Back-Up and DR as well as remote access and remote user maintenance. Will add mopre specifics later...

I have only positive things to say about Bruno's work at Syntellect. He was remarkably quick in responding to the many demands placed on him, but never went so fast that he missed a detail. He clearly explained situations and options, and came up with creative solutions to tough IT problems. He has a firm grasp of a wide range of technologies and was proactive in moving our infrastructure forward to provide additional benefits to our team. He specialized in Remote Support, as we had users in 13 countries, and was the "go to guy" for all our Domain Migration Projects; he even found a way to do one of them remotely. Bruno is a genuinely nice guy who cares about his co-workers, and he would be an asset to any organization that uses technology.

summary: Visit my latest endeavors in the arts and business...www.BaconApron.com                        (The "Why didn't I think of that!" Product of the YEAR!)www.TemporalProductions.com           (Audio/Video Production)https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8cdlyItcjIx-26VOSCKowA  (Temporal Productions Channel)www,TheComputerGuy.zone               (IT and Tech Support Services)www.RobertNolan.net                          (Author)www.SteveSquared.net                       (Simplifying Your Dreams)www.PLRServices.com                        (SMB and Corporate Services)www.Tesserasct.rocks                         (The BEST band you've NEVER heard of!)www.HOAReform.us                            (HOA's are no longer RELEVANT nor WANTED!)Coming soon! www.AZEL.us  AZ Entertainment LOOPMake sure to visit...www.IAmTheTeacher.org               (Saving the world, one open mind at a time...)I have been working with technology since I was quite young. I have always had an affinity for it. My first career track was in retail management. I became District Manager for two retail chains and ended up as top salesman as well. Left all of that to start my own company, The Computer Guy, and become an independent consultant. Did that for over ten years until I was hired for a one week contract, with Syntellect, and it turned into a full time position. I am now honing my IT skills, with a focus on BU, DR and security. I was also our best Domain Migration Implementer.Specialties: Backup and Disaster Recovery - User Support - Remote Administration - Domain Migration - Audio and Video Expertise - Adapting to and Creating New Paradigms - Management of People and ResourcesI am looking for a decision-level Management position, within ANY of my areas of expertise, preferably with a medium size, privately owned firm...
